turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Excuse me. I was just going up to my room.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Goodnight, Mr. Carpenter.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Mr. Carpenter, I--  Goodnight.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Goodnight, my dear.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh -- hello--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: May I see you for a minute?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I -- I was Just going to lunch.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: May I walk out with you?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I saw Bobby this morning before he went to school--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes--?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I want to know what he told you last night.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I -- I didn't really pay much attention--  Bobby has such an active imagination.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Did you believe what he told you?  I have a reason for asking this -- a very important reason.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What is it you want?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Before I ask you to be honest with me, perhaps I should be completely honest with you--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Just twelve.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: We'll be stuck here for a little while -- about thirty minutes.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: We could try pushing the other buttons.  I have a flashlight in my purse.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: It won't work.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: You see -- the electricity's been neutralized -- all over the world.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You hold great hope for this meeting.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I can see no other hope for your planet. If the meeting should fail, then I'm afraid there is no hope.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: It must be twelve-thirty.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes -- Just exactly.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Where are you going now?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Back to the boardinghouse. I'll be safe there for the afternoon -- and I can keep an eye on Bobby. He's the only other person who knows anything about--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No, wait a minute -- there's someone else.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Tom... He was there last night when Bobby told me what he saw.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I'm sure Barnhardt can arrange to hide me until the meeting.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Where is the meeting going to be?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: At the ship.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's only a few blocks to Barnhardt's.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I'm worried about Gort. I'm afraid of what he might do -- if anything should happen to me.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Gort?  But he's a robot. I mean -- without you, what could he do?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: There's no limit to what he could do. He could destroy the Earth.  If anything should happen to me, you must go to Gort. You must give him this message: "Klaatu barada nikto." Please repeat that.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: "Klaatu barada nikto."

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Remember those words.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I -- I thought you were--

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I was.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You mean he has the power of life and death?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: No -- that is a power reserved to the Almighty Spirit.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: This technique, in certain cases, can re-stimulate life for a limited period. It's a refinement of scientific principles known to your own people.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: But how -- how long--?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: How long will I live?  That no one can say.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: We'll miss you very much -- Bobby and I.  He won't have anyone to play with.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: He'll have you -- and Tom.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No. That's all finished.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I think I'm very lucky. You don't always get a chance to recognize a mistake before you make it.

turns.speaker: HILDA
turns.text: How dare you write on that blackboard!  Do you realize the Professor has been working on that problem for weeks?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: He'll catch on to it in no time now.

turns.speaker: HILDA
turns.text: How did you get in here? And what do you want?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: We came to see Professor Barnhardt.

turns.speaker: HILDA
turns.text: Well, he's not here. And he won't be back till this evening.  I think you'd better leave now. Unruffled, Klaatu turns to the desk and scribbles something on a scratch pad. He tears off the piece of paper and hands it to Hilda.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: You might keep this.  I think the professor will want to get in touch with me.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Is it worth anything?

turns.speaker: JEWELER
turns.text: I have never seen such a stone. Will you please tell me where it came from?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That's what I wanted you to tell me.

turns.speaker: JEWELER
turns.text: There are no diamonds like this -- any place in the world.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You sure about that?

turns.speaker: JEWELER
turns.text: Would you like to sell it?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No -- no, thanks.

turns.speaker: JEWELER
turns.text: I'd give you a very good price.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: The Professor's secretary says she found you in Barnhardt's room, making marks on his blackboard.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: I was only trying to be helpful. He was having difficulty with a problem.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Oh, I see. He was having trouble and you were helping him out.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: I suppose you know that Barnhardt does a lot of secret work for the Army.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: In this case the secret wouldn't be worth much. He doesn't know the answer himself.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: But I suppose you know the answer.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: It's really quite simple... The three- body problem, you know.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Your name's Carpenter -- that right?  Any identification, Mr. Carpenter? Driver's license -- social security number?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: No -- I'm afraid not.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Well, how do I know who you are?

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: You don't.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Okay -- book him and get him fixed up.  Looks like everybody's goin' nuts.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: They would have killed this man?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: People get hysterical enough, they do anything.  Look, Mr. Carpenter -- if you can't identify yourself, I got to send you over to the Army.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: How long will that take?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: They can tell right away. They've got a couple of doctors who saw this man in the hospital.  Take him over to G2.

turns.speaker: KLAATU
turns.text: May I suggest that you call the Professor?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Get going, will you, Brady -- before I get mad!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Just passing through Santa Carla?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, I'm a resident as of today and you'll probably be seeing a lot of me... I've been collecting comic books all my life... perhaps you'd like to see my collection?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't like horror comics.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: This one could save your life.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: How do you like Santa Carla?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's a pretty cool place if you're a Martian.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Yeah, you think we just work in a comic book store for our dad, huh?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This isn't a comic book store, right.  It's a bakery.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: We're fighters for Truth, Justice, and the American Way.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You better get some fresh air.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't like horror comics.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Think of this more as a survival manual... there's our number on the back, and pray that you never need to call us.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm gonna pray that I never need to call you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: All day.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Can't stand light?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Wears sunglasses in the <u>house</u>.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Salt sticks to the bottom of his feet.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: He's a vampire alright.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He's my brother.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: You better get a garlic T-shirt, buddy.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: They wouldn't be out in the daytime.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Exactly how many vampires have you actually destroyed?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: <u>I'll</u> have to drive!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: We don't ride with vampires.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Fine!  Stay here!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Burn rubber does not mean <u>warp</u> <u>speed</u>!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: We blew it, Edgar!  We lost it!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: They're gaining on us!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You gotta drive!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well... we blew Plan A.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Time to activate Plan B.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's Plan B?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: We've been aware of some very serious vampire activity in this town for a long time.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Santa Carla has become a haven for the undead.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: As a matter of fact, we're almost certain that ghouls and werewolves occupy high positions at City Hall.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: All together?

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Zero.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Okay.  Where's Nosferatu?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: The Prince of Darkness.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: The nightcrawler.  The bloodsucker.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: El Vampiro.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Should I run him through?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: I've only got one question for you, and I want an honest answer.  Have you taken any human victims yet?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: We unraveled in the face of the enemy!

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: They pulled a mind-scramble on us, man!  It wasn't our fault! They opened their eyes and talked!

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: They're looking at us.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: They're gonna book us.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: That's just the way we like it.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Did you see that sucker burn?!

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Man, we totally annihilated his night-stalkin' ass!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Two down and two to go.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: <u>Four</u> to go.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Whattaya mean?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Those two we brought back with us. The girl and the kid.  I don't trust 'em.  I say we terminate 'em while we can.

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: You know what?  You're absolutely right.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Death to all vampires!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: Maximum body-count.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: We are awesome monster-bashers!

turns.speaker: ALAN
turns.text: The meanest!

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: The baddest!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We still going?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Honda 250, huh?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: C'mon, Star.  Climb on.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Star?...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I can't beat a Triumph.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You don't have to beat me, Michael.  Just try to keep up.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We were gonna grab some food.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Good idea.  Marko.  We're hungry.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: So how do you like those maggots, Michael?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What?...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're eating maggots.  How do they taste?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Don't!  Stop!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why?  They're only noodles.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm my own man.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Get your bike.  We're going someplace.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What's going' on?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What's goin' on, Marko?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Where is she?!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hey, take it easy.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Where's Star, David?!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: If you ever want to see Star again, then you better come with us.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What is this, David?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're one of us, now -- aren't you?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Where you going?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: For a ride.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: With him?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: C'mon, Michael.  I want to go.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No.  Stick around.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Leave him alone.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sorry, Michael.  No hard feelings, huh?  Here.  Try these noodles.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Look.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're almost one of us now, Michael.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You can't kill me, Star.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: I will, David!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, Star.  Put it down.  Put it down.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And these Archies should be over here with the Richie Rich's.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Where the hell are you from, Kryton???

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Phoenix actually and these Bullwinkle and...

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Or a vampire.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Are you guys sniffing old newsprint or something?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: You think you're cool, don't you? You think you know what's really happening, don't you?  Well, you don't know shit, buddy.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: This is just our cover.  We're dedicated to a higher purpose.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Now I get it... you're like those people in the airport trying to get you to give them money. You're part of a cult.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Bad breath?  Long fingernails?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: His fingernails are longer, but he always has bad breath.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Get yourself a good sharp stake and drive it through his heart.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I can't do that!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I have something to tell you guys.  Not only is my own brother showing systems of being a vampire... but now I'm convinced my mother's <u>dating</u> one!

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: That is very probable.  What's your reasoning?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well... he only shows up at the store after dark.  And today, his dog attacked my mom.  Listen to this.  From <u>Vampires</u> <u>Everywhere</u>...  'Vampires require a daytime protector -- a <u>Guardian</u> -- to watch over them as they sleep. For it is during the day that the vampire is most vulnerable. Since they hold sway over animals, <u>fierce dogs -- the hounds of Hell</u> <u>-- are often employed for this</u> <u>purpose</u>.'

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: I wish they were vampires so I could nuke them in their hearts.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How do you know they're not?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: He's not glowing.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hit the lights again.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He's telling the truth!  Aren't you, Michael?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: To free you, we must destroy the leader of the vampires.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Just so you know:  If you try to stop us, or vamp-out in any way, I'll stake you without thinking twice about it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Chill out Edgar.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's that smell!?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Vampires, my friend.  Vampires.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I thought they'd be in coffins.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: That's exactly what this place is. One great big coffin.  Let's stake 'em.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh, no...

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: There's a cop behind us.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, Nanook!  Quiet!

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Your dog knows flesh-eaters when he smells 'em!

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: We don't have one yet.  And we only have two and a half hours to come up with one.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What happens in tow and a half hours?

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: The dun goes down and they'll be comin' for us.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Of course not!

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: If you're telling the truth, it means we can save you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: David.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: I don't want names!  Just lead me to him.  Where's their nest?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'll take you there.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I said, <u>I'll take you there</u>. Nobody's going near Star without me.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Okay, okay.

turns.speaker: EDGAR
turns.text: Don't go out there!  Stop him!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sam, don't --

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Lucy, you're the only woman I ever knew didn't improve her situation by getting divorced.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: A big legal war wasn't going to improve anybody's situation.  We've all been through enough.  Besides I was raised better than that. Thanks for having us, Dad.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Ouch, my hair...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: When I dressed like you do now, you threw me out of the house. I used to hate your short hair and your uptight suits... then I went ahead and married one... I went Yuppie and you became a hippie... Were still out of synch.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I can't sleep with the closet door open, either.  Not even a crack.  Your father doesn't mind, though. It could be wide open for all he cared.  I think one of the reasons I divorced him was because he never believed... in the horror... of the <u>closet monster</u>!

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Closet monster!?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Dad!  Don't sneak up on people like that!

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: It's called the Indian walk. Walkin' without makin' a sound.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Smells good.  When do we eat?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I told Max eight o'clock.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Max?  You men we're having company again?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: 'Again'?  Dad... you haven't had company in this house since Mom died eight years ago.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Right.  An' now we're having company <u>again</u>.  I'll take mine to go.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: ... And stay outta here.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You have a T.V.?

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: No, I just like to read the <u>T.V.</u> <u>Guide</u>.  Read the <u>T.V. Guide</u>, you don't need a T.V...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thanks, Grandpa...

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Lots more where he came from.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Grandpa, stop doin' the Indian Walk!

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Gotta keep in practice.  It's a dyin' art.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Good!

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Whatcha doin' over here?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh... I was just... having a look at your truck.  What's all that wood in there for?

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Been fixin' to build me fence one of these days.  Bought all the materials, then put it off... for about ten years.  Well, one more day won't hurt. Wanna go into town with me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Great.  I wanna get some new comics.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Are we havin' fun or what?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I thought we were goin' into town.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: I hate goin' into town.  That's about as close to town as I like to get.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Grandpa, the Widow Johnson called. She said to pick her up a seven instead of eight.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: Did we have a date tonight?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I guess so.  She said not to be late.

turns.speaker: GRANDPA
turns.text: I better get cleaned up, then.

turns.speaker: LADDIE
turns.text: Hi... I'm Laddie.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: This is Michael.

turns.speaker: LADDIE
turns.text: I had the dream again about <u>them</u>.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Who, Laddie?

turns.speaker: LADDIE
turns.text: I know it was them, Star.  I'm sure of it.  He was working in the yard -- hammering something.  The yard was big with lots of grass.  There was no boardwalk and no ocean.  She was bringing him something cold to drink... and had red hair.  I was there, too.  And a dog -- but I don't know its name.  I was running and the dog was chasing me. Then I turned around and chased the dog.  They were watching me. Drinking their cold drinks and laughing.  And I was laughing, too.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Laddie... you can <u>still</u> remember. You can still remember home.

turns.speaker: LADDIE
turns.text: It was a dream, Star.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: No, Laddie.  It was a <u>memory</u>.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: You didn't tell David?

turns.speaker: LADDIE
turns.text: No.  Just you.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Promise me you'll keep it that way.  You're not like the others, Laddie.  You're like me.  I can still remember, too.

turns.speaker: LADDIE
turns.text: You like Michael.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: I like Michael.

turns.speaker: LADDIE
turns.text: You better not like him too much.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Still mad at me?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: For what.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: For everything.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: He looks dead.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: He's just a deep sleeper.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: He's not breathing, Mom.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's early.  Why do we have to go home?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Bring your own wheels tomorrow night and you can stay as long as you want... well 'til eleven thirty maybe.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'll hitch.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Oh, no, you won't.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: See you later.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I get off in another twenty minutes.  I thought maybe we'd all get a bite together.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'll pass.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Michael, are you still in bed?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.  I'm up.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Michael, will you do me a favor this evening?  Will you stay home with Sam tonight?  I'm meeting Max for dinner after work.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I watch him all day.  The only time I have more myself is at night.  Let Grandpa watch him.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Grandpa has plans of his own.  Michael, I want you to do this. Everybody has been bending over backwards for you.  You come home late.  You sleep in to the middle of the day -- Sam is always alone. You do exactly what you want... tonight do what I want for a change.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Okay.
